summary: The @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry package has peer dependencies on @temporalio/activity, @temporalio/common, @temporalio/worker, and @temporalio/workflow, causing Yarn warnings when consuming only @temporalio/client. The fix is to mark these peer dependencies as optional.
userImpact: Users get Yarn peer dependency warnings when using @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry with only @temporalio/client, requiring unnecessary package installations.
rootCause: Peer dependencies in @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry are not marked as optional, causing package managers to warn about missing dependencies in projects that don't need all components.
proposedFix: Add peerDependenciesMeta entries with optional: true for all @temporalio/* peer dependencies, and add runtime detection to handle missing optional packages gracefully.
resolutionDetails: Peer dependencies were marked as optional using peerDependenciesMeta configuration with runtime package detection.
keyQuote: The correct thing to do would be to add a `peerDependenciesMeta.*.optional: true` entry for all `@temporalio/*` dependencies.
